page.title: 13 TRANSPORT
page.content: The main communication route is the A376 which runs N-S along the line of the Otter,but on terraces always above 10 metres.This road by-passes E.Budleigh & is a busy commuter & coastal access route.Minor roads run from this westward up & onto & across the commons.The Yettington road bridges the Otter & runs through Otterton in the east.All roads are very busy during the holiday period (May-Sept).A single-decker Devon General bus runs along the A376 at hour intervals en route from Exmouth to Sidmouth.The fare from E.Budleigh to B.Salterton is 60p & to Exmouth is 100p. This is the only public transport in the area now the railway has gone.Use of private cars is essential for mobility;taxis are a more expensive alternative. See also "Public Transport Decline" p.14.By A.K.,J.R.& 4th yr.Geographers.
